item.title: EIGRP Multipathing
EIGRP Path Selection
item.description: – Terminology Successor (S) – path with the lowest cost to the prefix. Feasible Successor (FS) – backup paths for S. Reported Distance (RD) – a neighbours distance to the prefix.

item.title: EIGRP Stub Routing
item.description: – In the interest of conserving local router resources and alleviating network load, EIGRP supports stub routing. A stub router is a router that should not be used as a transit router, meaning that the stub router does not have any information about other EIGRP routers behind it and does not need to advertise anything other than locally connected and summary routes to its neighbours.
